Study: Epidemiological and Clinical Characteristics of Children with Coronavirus Disease 2019
Excerpt: There was only one severe pneumonia case among the 74 infected children, and the rest consisted of 20 cases of asymptomatic infection, 24 acute upper respiratory tract infection cases and 29 mild pneumonia cases, accounting for 27.03%, 32.43% and 39.19% respectively.

Study: Clinical and epidemiological features of 36 children with coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) in Zhejiang, China: an observational cohort study
Excerpt: 17 (47%) of 36 children had mild clinical type, with ten (28%) patients asymptomatic and seven (19%) showing acute upper respiratory symptoms.

Study: High incidence of asymptomatic SARS-CoV-2 infection, Chongqing, China
Excerpt: In different age groups, the proportion of asymptomatic patient was the highest(28.6%) in children group under 14,

Journal: The New England Journal of Medicine
Excerpt: A total of 27 patients (15.8%) did not have any symptoms of infection or radiologic features of pneumonia.

Study: Epidemiological Characteristics of 2143 Pediatric Patients With 2019 Coronavirus Disease in China
The clinical and epidemiological features and hints of 82 confirmed COVID-19 pediatric cases aged 0-16 in Wuhan, China
Excerpt: Most have mild clinical symptoms with 8 no symptoms.

Study: Clinical analysis of 31 cases of 2019 novel coronavirus infection in children from six provinces (autonomous region) of northern China
Excerpt: Among the 31 children, there were 4 cases of asymptomatic type (13%), 13 cases of mild type (42%), 14 cases of normal type (45%, including 3 cases of subclinical type).

Study: Preliminary epidemiological analysis on children and adolescents with novel coronavirus disease 2019 outside Hubei Province, China: an observational study utilizing crowdsourced data
Excerpt: Fever was the most common symptom, present in 17 (68.0%) of those cases, while 2 (8.0%) cases were asymptomatic.
